column4: hello how to edit the packages after copying the packages in computers?why Ubuntu will erase the packages in /var/cache/apt/archives/ ?
what are you trying to do?

: okay here (pc im using right) ive downloaded 300+ packages and installed some applications..how to copy the 300+ packages and the applications that ive installed in pc2? and is it true that if you dont edit it it will erase?
you want to create a local apt-mirror
: yes :) for no time hushle or time consuming..i will just copy the packages from pc1 and paste it to pc2...
you can do just that, but it would be a bit tedious to do continuously
copy them from one computer's archive to the other's, then when you sudo apt-get install them, it will use the version you copied
: how to copy?which directory?
the contents of /var/cache/apt/archives
: the packages right...what about the applications that ive installed in pc1?can i copy them and paste to pc2?
no, you copy the packages only, then install them
you can use the !clone feature to get all the packages installed on one computer installed on another, but that doesn't copy the packages themselves, just the names
: i got it now. :)
I'm curious, do you have a low bandwidth cap or really slow net connection?
: slow net connection....thats why i dont want to download from the scratch again
does that do anything pidgin can't?
: im just exploring if its possible to use ym. :)
yahoo messenger for linux is horribly old, unless it can do some feature that pidgin can't (voice chat or file transfer), and I highly doubt that's the case, it's not going to accomplish anything
both cairo-dock and avant-window-navigator use some gnome libraries, but both will work on kde
: ok. nickrud ok
nickrud : is it possible to switch to gnome without disconnecting my net here?
you don't need to switch to gnome, but you can install the ubuntu-desktop package to give you a full gnome desktop (assuming you have enough HDD space)
